#Text=[0073] Prior to conducting the third reaction, the process engineer can select values for three of the four parameters F.sub.3Si, F.sub.3Gm, T.sub.3, and z (it is assumed that the dilution rating d.sub.3 is also known).
#Text=Then, Equations 38 (or 39) and 42 can be used to calculate the value of the unselected parameter.
#Text=Alternatively, Equations 40, 41, and 43 can be used if the germane flow rates (as opposed to the flow rates of the germane/carrier mixture) are known and/or desired to be calculated.
#Text=Several examples are presented below for a better understanding of the methods for calculating these parameters.
#Text=[0074] This method has been conducted in a temperature limited regime where the crystal growth is affected mostly by surface effects.
#Text=This shows that it is independent of the actual silicon and germanium precursors.
#Text=Some embodiments of the invention are not limited to hydride precursors, such as Si.sub.nH.sub.2n+2 and Ge.sub.mH.sub.2m+2.
#Text=For example, this method can be used with chlorinated precursors.

#Text=[0075] Note that it is possible to deposit the first layer Si.sub.1-xGe.sub.x and second layer Si.sub.1-yGe.sub.y on the same wafer, and then remove the wafer for analysis of the deposited layers in order to set process conditions for depositing the third layer Si.sub.1-zGe.sub.z on any wafer, including the same wafer if desired.
#Text=Effect of Additional Substances
